Tolkien-related events that took place in 1941.

content.title: January
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien resigns as Governor of King Edward's School, Birmingham.
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 41.
12 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 42.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 42a.

content.title: March
content.content:
6 - J.R.R. Tolkien starts writing letter 43.
12 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 43a.
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 44.

content.title: April
content.content: 30 - Sean Arnold, who would play Odo Proudfoot in The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series), is born.

content.title: August
content.content: 4 - Martin Jarvis, who would voice Gandalf in The Lord of the Rings: Conquest, is born.

content.title: November
content.content:
18 - David Hemmings, who would play Bergil in The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series), is born.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 46.

content.title: December
content.content:
10 - Baillie Tolkien is born.
22 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.
24 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.
? - Ian Mune, who played a bounder in The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, is born.

content.title: Note
content.content:
While writing The Lord of the Rings, Tolkien modelled the lunar phases of T.A. 3018 on those of this year, with an offset of +5/6 days.[1]
